_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: 10 Screw Compressors and 5 Recepitating Compressors and various safety checks
_prev_prog_3.Description: SuperValu's implementation of the PSM program includes employee education in the hazards of ammonia and measures that can be used to reduce employee and community exposure to accidental releases. The plan includes a regular preventative maintenance program (mechanical integrity) for the ammonia  system components, and aprogram for both pre-startup safety reviews and management of change (MOC) to the ammonia refrigeration system. The program also includes operating procedures for the safe operation of the refrigeration system, specific requirements for safe work practices (such as safe approaches to welding and similar hot work), and safety requiremenst for contractors who may be hired to work on the refrigeration system. Supervalu has a procedure in place for investigating incidenst to ensure root causes are identified and corrective actions are taken to minimize potential for recurrence of incidents. The program also has a procedure for conducting compliance audits to ensure the PSM program is being implemented at the Champaign facility. Lastly the PSM program incorporates the facility's emergency response plan and places special emphasis on handling accidental releases of ammonia and coordination of emergency response activities with the local fire department and other response agencies.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary


SUPERVALU Inc Champaign Distribution Center is committed to providing a safe and healthful work environment for its employees and visitors.

It is important to establish emergency action plans to protect life and property.  Experience has shown that actions taken during an emergency are seldom effective unless planned in advance.  

It is imperative that plans to accomplish evacuation quickly, efficiently and safely have been developed and communicated to all employees.

The Champaign Distribution Center is a food distribution warehouse supplying frozen foods perishables and dry goods to over 300 retail grocery stores in a five-state area.  Anhydrous Ammonia is used as a refrigerant to maintain cooler and freezer rooms in a quantity of 39,700 lbs.  The worst-case scenario would be if the largest vessel ruptured, releasing 12,400 lbs into the atmosphere.  To prevent this from happening the engine room is equipped with emergency ventilation and all electrical switchgears are located away from the engine room.  A master shut off button is located at the gatehouse outside of the facility as well.  This release would affect a 1.5-mile radius with a population of 728 residents.  

The ammonia system piping has been relocated outside above the roof to eliminate exposure.  The Champaign Distribution Center is covered by OSHA's PSM rule.  We are dedicated to the prevention of catastrophic releases and minimizing the consequences of such release.  Employee involvement, education and training are conducted on a regular basis to maintain employee understanding and awareness of PSM information.  The Champaign Distribution Center has not had ANY reportable accident history in the last five years. 

The Emergency Response Program of the Champaign Distribution Center has been developed and coordinated with the LEPC, ESDA and the Champaign / Urbana HAZMAT Teams.  The local Hazmat Teams will conduct bi-annual drills at the facility, a copy of the ammonia system bl

ueprints have been given to the Teams to give them a working knowledge of our system.  The employees are trained in their initial orientation and annual refresher training on PSM.  The Distribution Center conducts four emergency evacuation drills on an annual basis.  

Any release that registers 100 PPM will result in immediate notification 911.  The Champaign / Urbana HAZMAT Teams will respond to the call.  The facility maintains a "Telephone Tree" which is put into effect in the event of an emergency, to notify the community.  An on-site medical facility is staffed by a nurse and will be available to assist with any injuries.  The facility has a written Emergency Action Plan, which is reviewed by employees and management annually.
